v.v: These are sayings of King Lemuel—an oracle his mother taught him.
She says: You are my son; I carried you in my womb;
Do not give your strength to women;
Lemuel, kings should be careful about drinking wine;
They could drink but then they might forget that they made a decree of the king,
Give strong drink to those who are dying
One who drinks will forget he is poor,
Speak for those who cannot speak for themselves,
Speak out and render judgment according to what is right;
Who can find a wife who is good at many things?
Her husband completely trusts her,
She does good things for him and not evil,
She finds wool and flax in the market,
She is like the merchant ships
She gets up before dawn to prepare food for her family,
She goes out and considers what field she will buy, and she buys it.
She prepares herself with her strength,
She knows when she is getting a good profit from her business.
She holds the spindle,
She gives an outstretched hand to help the poor.
She is not worried about the snow,
She makes covers for the beds.
Her husband is well known at the city gates,
She makes linen garments and she sells them.
She is strong in her character and respected,
When she speaks, she says what is wise,
She watches over everything that is done in her household,
Her children speak highly of her;
He says to her, “There are many women who do admirable things,
Elegance can deceive
Give her what she has earned,

v: you are the son, I made promises to Yahweh for you.
and do not tell what your plans are, to the women who destroy kings.
and a king should never ask, “Where is the strong drink?”
and tear down the rights of those who have been taken advantage of.
and to those who are grieving their loss.
and he will not remember his trouble.
speak for those who are approaching death.
and plead for justice to come in the cases of the poor and the needy.
Her value is much more than the jewels she could wear.
and because of her, he will never be poor.
all the days of her life.
and she enjoys spinning it to make yarn and fabric.
because she brings her food to her home from far away.
and she gives each servant girl her duties for the day.
With the money she has made in other ventures,
she plants a vineyard.
and her arms are strong, able to do hard work.
She keeps a lamp burning all night long.
and then she spins the thread that she will use.
for everyone in her house have the best winter coats.
She wears fine purple linen clothes—the color of royalty.
and there at the gates he sits with the other leaders of the town.
She sells sashes to shop owners.
and she laughs at what will happen in the future.
and she lives by the law of kindness.
and nothing in her actions would be anything like laziness.
her husband also praises her.
but you surpass them all!”
and make you think more highly of a person than you should;
and beauty has no lasting value.
But a woman who honors Yahweh will be praised for the person she is.
and her works will praise her among the leaders of the town.
